intro: Oxythece rigidopsis, commonly known as the rigid stalked bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, inflated bladders that trap aquatic prey. Native to freshwater habitats in Europe and Asia, it thrives in still or slow-moving waters. The plant lacks true roots and instead absorbs nutrients through its bladders and leaves. Its unique morphology and carnivorous adaptation make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
